TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MenuEventArgs extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the and events of a control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class is used to store the event data passed to an event handler for the events in the following table.
|Event|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick>|Occurs when a menu item is clicked. This event is commonly used to synchronize a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control with another control on the page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound>|Occurs when a menu item is bound to data. This event is commonly used to modify a menu item before it is rendered in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.|
Depending on the event raised, you can access the menu item clicked by the user or the menu item being bound to data by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> object passed to the event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound> event to modify the properties of a menu item before it is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem.ImageUrl%2A> property of the `Home` menu item is set to display an image in that menu item only. For this example to work correctly, you must copy the sample site map data below to a file named Web.sitemap.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MenuEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuEventArgs/CS/menueventargscs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MenuEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuEventArgs/VB/menueventargsvb.aspx#1)] -->
The following is sample site map data for the previous example.
`<siteMap>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Home.aspx"`
`title="Home"`
`description="Home">`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Music.aspx"`
`title="Music"`
`description="Music">`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Classical.aspx"`
`title="Classical"`
`description="Classical"/>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Rock.aspx"`
`title="Rock"`
`description="Rock"/>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Jazz.aspx"`
`title="Jazz"`
`description="Jazz"/>`
`</siteMapNode>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Movies.aspx"`
`title="Movies"`
`description="Movies">`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Action.aspx"`
`title="Action"`
`description="Action"/>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Drama.aspx"`
`title="Drama"`
`description="Drama"/>`
`<siteMapNode url="~\Musical.aspx"`
`title="Musical"`
`description="Musical"/>`
`</siteMapNode>`
`</siteMapNode>`
`</siteMap>`

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: For the event, this parameter represents the menu item clicked by the user. For the event, this parameter represents the menu item being bound to data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified menu item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class from the specified menu item. The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A>|<xref:System.String.Empty>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem> object specified by the `item` parameter.|

MemberSignature.Value: public MenuEventArgs (System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem item, object commandSource, System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs originalArgs);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem item, object commandSource, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs originalArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: For the event, this parameter represents the menu item clicked by the user. For the event, this parameter represents the menu item being bound to data.
A that contains the command name and command argument values for the menu item.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified menu item, command source, and event arguments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class from the specified menu item, command source, and event arguments. The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A>|The value of the `originalArgs.CommandArgument` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A>|The value of the `originalArgs.CommandName` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The <xref:System.Object> specified by the `commandSource` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem> object specified by the `item` parameter.|

Docs.summary: Gets the that raised the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Object> that raised the event.

Docs.summary: Gets the menu item associated with the event raised.
Docs.value: A that represents the menu item associated with the event raised.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A> property to access or modify the properties of the menu item associated with the event raised. For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick> event, this item represents the menu item clicked by the user. For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound> event, this item represents the menu item being bound to data.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A> property to access the properties of the menu item clicked by the user. The text of the selected menu item is displayed on the page.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[MenuEventArgsItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuEventArgsItem/CS/menueventargsitemcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[MenuEventArgsItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuEventArgsItem/VB/menueventargsitemvb.aspx#1)] -->
